title: SpaceX, NASA to launch Crew-9 with two people
summary: SpaceX and NASA are ready to launch Crew-9 for its six-month mission aboard the International Space Station (ISS). The SpaceX Crew Dragon capsule, originally set to launch with four people, will only launch with two. The empty seats will be used by Boeing Crew Flight Test astronauts Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams to return home in February 2025.

title: Anduril lands $25 million contract to upgrade aging space surveillance network
summary: The company will modernize data integration and communications for the U.S. military’s Space Surveillance Network (SSN) used to track space objects and missile launches

title: BlackSky to equip its future satellites with military-compatible laser terminals
summary: The company won a U..S. Navy contract to study the compatibility of its Gen-3 satellites with military ground terminals

title: Two-man crew bound for space station will give Starliner astronauts a ride home in February
summary: NASA's 10th Crew Dragon flight to the International Space Station is ready for launch Saturday with two long-duration crew members on board along with two empty seats that will be used next February to carry Boeing's Starliner astronauts back to Earth after an extended stay in orbit.

title: The Science of the Perfect Cup for Coffee
summary: Material research is behind the design of a temperature-regulating mug

title: Firefly offers insight on MLV testing, reusability plans
summary: As Firefly Aerospace prepares for its upcoming Alpha rocket launches, work continues apace on its next-generation Medium Launch Vehicle (MLV) rocket with its Miranda and Vira engines, utilizing its Briggs test site in Texas. MLV’s Chief Engineer, Miles Gray, showed NSF around the test site to update the status of the new vehicle and engines while also noting the vehicle is being designed with reusability in mind, involving a recovery that follows a similar path as SpaceX’s Starship Mechazilla catch system.

title: The Stanley Cup Comes to Kennedy
summary: The Stanley Cup, won in 2024 by the Florida Panthers, made a visit to the Vehicle Assembly Building (VAB) at NASA’s Kennedy Space Center on Sept. 17, 2024, as part of its championship tour. The VAB currently houses components of the agency’s Artemis II mission, the first crewed mission on NASA’s path to establishing a […]

title: Chief Engineer Dr. Donald Mendoza
summary: “From my earliest childhood, flight had always captivated me. I lived out in the boonies and the farmlands, so I didn’t have neighbors to go and play with. title: Launch Your Creativity with These Space Crafts!
summary: In honor of the completion of our Nancy Grace Roman Space Telescope’s spacecraft — the vehicle that will maneuver the observatory to its place in space and enable it to function once there — we’re bringing you some space crafts you can complete at home!
